channel.title: Comments on: Is Meteor The Future Of Node.JS Development?

item.title: By: Scotty Vernon
item.dc:creator: Scotty Vernon
item.description:
I've been tooling up on Node for a few months now; looking for excuses to build apps on it. Came across meteor about 10minutes ago, and the screencast has blown my mind.
Reminds me of seeing the Rails screencasts for the first time years ago and thinking, 'this changes everything!'.
I'm definitely going to follow it's development! Looks like Node is coming of age!
item.content:encoded:
I’ve been tooling up on Node for a few months now; looking for excuses to build apps on it. Came across meteor about 10minutes ago, and the screencast has blown my mind.

Reminds me of seeing the Rails screencasts for the first time years ago and thinking, ‘this changes everything!’.

I’m definitely going to follow it’s development! Looks like Node is coming of age!

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2012/04/12/is-meteor-the-future-of-node-js-development/#comment-3950">Justin Carmony</a>.
Devil is in the details :-)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Justin Carmony.

item.title: By: Justin Carmony
item.dc:creator: Justin Carmony
item.description: I saw that too, and it looks pretty impressive. I'm interested to see how it will take on challenges of running it in production and protecting your data. A few of those things sent off my internal security alarms in my brain. But exciting to see these kinds of development projects.
item.content:encoded: I saw that too, and it looks pretty impressive. I’m interested to see how it will take on challenges of running it in production and protecting your data. A few of those things sent off my internal security alarms in my brain. But exciting to see these kinds of development projects.
